intro: Eritrichium mandshuricum, commonly known as the Siberian mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale purple, and it has hairy, lobed leaves that help it retain heat in its harsh environment. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Eritrichium mandshuricum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
